Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We are hiring a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data Science team!




As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be…

Driving Customer Value with Data Insights: Providing key customers with meaningful data, analyses, dashboards, and advice on operational best practices, managing customer relationships regarding data insights, and ensuring their data needs are met.
Empowering Spare with Actionable Insights: Helping teams across Spare (especially Product, Sales, and Customer Success) gain access to the data and insights they need to make informed decisions and perform their functions effectively.
Shaping Spare's Strategy with Data Insights: Working with leadership to shape strategic decisions across the organization through data-driven insights.




This role follows a hybrid schedule. We require team members to be in the office on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, with the option to work remotely on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Our office is located in downtown Vancouver, and we believe this balance fosters strong collaboration while supporting flexibility.




Responsibilities:

Prioritize and Manage Requests: Handle and prioritize incoming data requests from both internal teams and external customers, ensuring timely and effective responses to their needs.
Data Analysis and Reporting: Perform detailed analyses using SQL, Python, and BI tools like Metabase or Mixpanel to extract insights, answer business questions, and develop/maintain dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
Insight Communication: Present findings and actionable recommendations clearly to a range of audiences, including non-technical stakeholders and customers, ensuring understanding and impact.
Consulting and Collaboration: Act as a data consultant for key customers, advising on best practices, while working closely with internal teams (e.g., Product, Sales) to address their data needs and support their initiatives.
Process Improvement and Alignment: Gather feedback to enhance data processes, participate in planning and alignment meetings across teams, and collaborate with Data Engineering to improve infrastructure, models, and pipelines.
Governance and Advocacy: Ensure data integrity, privacy compliance, and maintain clear documentation, while championing data-driven decision-making and fostering a data-centric culture across the organization.




Key Results:

Improved Customer Satisfaction: Measured through qualitative feedback (pulse updates gathered by Partner Success Managers) and potentially quantitative measures like NPS scores related to data support.
Effective Internal Support: Measured through qualitative feedback (e.g., retrospectives with internal teams) and quantitative metrics like internal NPS scores for data support, and tracking usage/adoption of data tools (e.g., Daily Active Users on Metabase dashboards).
Timely & Accurate Data Delivery: Successfully managing and fulfilling the backlog of internal and external data requests according to agreed-upon priorities and timelines.
Actionable Insights: Delivering analyses and insights that demonstrably inform customer operations or internal decision-making.




Must-Have:

Intermediate to Senior-level expertise in data science.
Strong technical ability in data analysis, insight generation, and working with large datasets.
Experience with SQL, Pythona and other programming languages for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Metabase, Mixpanel, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar).
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences, especially customers.
Proven ability to manage customer relationships and act in a consultative capacity.
Demonstrates Customer Obsession and the ability to Execute with Urgency (Spare Guiding Principles).




Nice-to-Have:

An interest in Spare's mission and the transit industry.
Experience working in a B2B/SaaS startup environment.




Don’t meet every single requirement?

Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification in the job posting.




At Spare, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment so we strongly encourage you to apply even if you don't believe you meet every single qualification outlined. We also do our best to respond to all applications we receive.

Show more
HTML:
We are hiring a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data Science team!


As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be…

  • Driving Customer Value with Data Insights: Providing key customers with meaningful data, analyses, dashboards, and advice on operational best practices, managing customer relationships regarding data insights, and ensuring their data needs are met.
  • Empowering Spare with Actionable Insights: Helping teams across Spare (especially Product, Sales, and Customer Success) gain access to the data and insights they need to make informed decisions and perform their functions effectively.
  • Shaping Spare's Strategy with Data Insights: Working with leadership to shape strategic decisions across the organization through data-driven insights.


This role follows a hybrid schedule. We require team members to be in the office on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, with the option to work remotely on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Our office is located in downtown Vancouver, and we believe this balance fosters strong collaboration while supporting flexibility.


Responsibilities:

  • Prioritize and Manage Requests: Handle and prioritize incoming data requests from both internal teams and external customers, ensuring timely and effective responses to their needs.
  • Data Analysis and Reporting: Perform detailed analyses using SQL, Python, and BI tools like Metabase or Mixpanel to extract insights, answer business questions, and develop/maintain dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
  • Insight Communication: Present findings and actionable recommendations clearly to a range of audiences, including non-technical stakeholders and customers, ensuring understanding and impact.
  • Consulting and Collaboration: Act as a data consultant for key customers, advising on best practices, while working closely with internal teams (e.g., Product, Sales) to address their data needs and support their initiatives.
  • Process Improvement and Alignment: Gather feedback to enhance data processes, participate in planning and alignment meetings across teams, and collaborate with Data Engineering to improve infrastructure, models, and pipelines.
  • Governance and Advocacy: Ensure data integrity, privacy compliance, and maintain clear documentation, while championing data-driven decision-making and fostering a data-centric culture across the organization.


Key Results:

  • Improved Customer Satisfaction: Measured through qualitative feedback (pulse updates gathered by Partner Success Managers) and potentially quantitative measures like NPS scores related to data support.
  • Effective Internal Support: Measured through qualitative feedback (e.g., retrospectives with internal teams) and quantitative metrics like internal NPS scores for data support, and tracking usage/adoption of data tools (e.g., Daily Active Users on Metabase dashboards).
  • Timely & Accurate Data Delivery: Successfully managing and fulfilling the backlog of internal and external data requests according to agreed-upon priorities and timelines.
  • Actionable Insights: Delivering analyses and insights that demonstrably inform customer operations or internal decision-making.


Must-Have:

  • Intermediate to Senior-level expertise in data science.
  • Strong technical ability in data analysis, insight generation, and working with large datasets.
  • Experience with SQL, Pythona and other programming languages for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Metabase, Mixpanel, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar).
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences, especially customers.
  • Proven ability to manage customer relationships and act in a consultative capacity.
  • Demonstrates Customer Obsession and the ability to Execute with Urgency (Spare Guiding Principles).


Nice-to-Have:

  • An interest in Spare's mission and the transit industry.
  • Experience working in a B2B/SaaS startup environment.


Don’t meet every single requirement?

Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification in the job posting.


At Spare, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment so we strongly encourage you to apply even if you don't believe you meet every single qualification outlined. We also do our best to respond to all applications we receive.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Nos équipes sont au coeur de tout ce que nous faisons. Ensemble, nous aidons les gens, les entreprises et la société à aller de l’avant dans les bons moments et à être résilients dans les moments difficiles.

Notre promesse aux employés, c’est ce qu’Intact vous promet en échange de votre engagement à vivre nos valeurs, à donner le meilleur de vous-mêmes, à être ouverts au changement et à vous investir dans votre carrière. Nous vous promettons de vous soutenir et de vous offrir des occasions de développement et des avantages financiers axés sur la performance dans un milieu de travail où vous pouvez façonner l’avenir, réussir en équipe et évoluer avec nous.

À propos du poste

At Intact Lab, we leverage machine learning, data science, agility, and UX to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Here, innovation is everyone's responsibility. Are you ready to make your mark?

Are you an expert in machine learning or insurance pricing? Are you passionate about advanced analytics and big data? Do you keep up with the latest trends in analytics and jump at the chance to experiment with new tools? We have the perfect opportunity for you!

What You'll Do Here


Be the technical leader who assists in identifying and defining pricing improvement opportunities and helps develop solutions using machine learning and advanced statistics.
Ensure that teams build AI systems aligned with business goals and quality expectations, considering sustainability and following best practices and internal policies.
Help achieve long-term business objectives by identifying and implementing solutions to highly uncertain problems with the utmost scientific rigor.
Influence the technical direction of the lab by making recommendations based on scientific and business outcomes.
Contribute to the strategic vision of projects within your business unit by identifying opportunities in existing processes and providing innovative solutions. Rally multiple stakeholders to this vision.
Coach and mentor senior actuaries and data scientists and act as a technical reference for management.
Validate machine learning solutions and determine their readiness for deployment in production.
Help teams maintain a high scientific standard by ensuring adherence to data science standard of practice and participating in their evolution.


What You Bring To The Table


Master's degree or PhD in a relevant discipline (such as, but not limited to: mathematics, computer science, economics, statistics, physics), or any combination of equivalent education and experience, such as a strong background in actuarial sciences (e.g., FCAS).
Strong business acumen with prior experience working across multiple business units in large organizations.
Expert understanding or approximately 8 years of experience in at least one of the following areas of advanced analytics, modeling, or machine learning: pricing, predictive modeling, time series forecasting, computer vision, natural language processing including generative AI, or any other AI application relevant to insurance.
Strong skills in communication, time management, teamwork, and organization. Demonstrated ability to influence peers across teams.
Proven experience in delivering complex projects with a high level of autonomy.
The position requires programming expertise, preferably in Python and its popular libraries/frameworks such as scikit-learn, xgboost, pytorch, etc. Candidates must either show their acquired skills or demonstrate their ability to acquire them.
Ability to perform advanced data analyses using cloud-based data analytics platforms like Databricks or AWS SageMaker is a plus. More broadly, knowledge of cloud solutions such as AWS and practical experience in building solutions integrating its services is a plus.


Le Salaire Du Candidat Retenu Se Situera Généralement Dans L’échelle Suivante Et Tiendra Compte De Plusieurs Facteurs Comme Son Expérience De Travail, Ses Compétences, Sa Contribution Anticipée Quant Au Poste, L’équité Interne, Ses Niveaux D’autonomie Et De Performance Et Son Lieu De Travail

$120,200.00 - $180,200.00

Ce que nous offrons

Notre formule hybride permet de maintenir un équilibre entre le télétravail et les avantages des interactions en personne.

En Travaillant Chez Nous, Vous Aurez Tous Les Outils Pour Donner Le Meilleur De Vous-même Chaque Jour. Voici Ce à Quoi Vous Pouvez Vous Attendre En Devenant Un Membre Permanent De Notre Équipe


Un régime complet d’avantages financiers qui reconnaît vos succès
Un régime d’achat d’actions des employés parmi les meilleurs de l’industrie, avec une cotisation de contrepartie correspondant à 50 % des actions nettes achetées
Un régime de retraite et d’avantages sociaux flexible et complet, et un service de soins de santé virtuels
Des aménagements de travail flexibles
La possibilité d'acheter jusqu'à cinq jours de congé supplémentaires chaque année
Un compte de dépenses mieux-être pour favoriser un mode de vie sain et actif
Un accès à des outils et à des ressources qui vous aident à rester en santé physiquement et mentalement, à accueillir le changement et à communiquer avec vos collègues
Un écosystème d’apprentissage dynamique en milieu de travail, offrant des parcours d’apprentissage, du contenu interactif en ligne et des programmes inspirants
Des réseaux inclusifs dirigés par des employés pour informer, inspirer, faire entendre, établir des relations et offrir des occasions de perfectionnement
Des dirigeants et des collègues inspirants qui vous soutiennent et contribuent à votre développement
Un programme d’action communautaire, car ce qui vous tient à cœur fait partie de ce qui vous rend unique et la façon dont vous redonner à la collectivité doit l'être tout autant


Égalité d’accès à l’emploi

Le respect est une des valeurs d’Intact. Pour nous, cela veut dire voir la diversité comme une force. Nous veillons à offrir un milieu de travail accessible où tout le monde se sent valorisé, inclus et encouragé à partager son point de vue unique.

Nous encourageons les candidatures de personnes appartenant à des groupes dignes d’équité, notamment les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées, les personnes noires et les personnes faisant partie de la communauté 2ELGBTQI+.

Dans le cadre de l’engagement d’Intact envers la réconciliation, nous reconnaissons que nous travaillons, nous nous réunissons et voyageons dans un territoire habité à l’origine par les Premières Nations, les Métis, les Inuits, appelé aujourd’hui Canada. Cette histoire s’étend sur plusieurs siècles et continue d’évoluer aujourd’hui.

Nous avons mis en place des politiques qui visent à assurer aux personnes handicapées l’égalité d’accès et de participation, entre autres grâce à des mesures d’adaptation (accommodements) en milieu de travail. Un exemplaire de ces politiques est disponible sur demande.

Si nous pouvons rendre le processus de recrutement plus accessible pour vous, n’hésitez pas à nous le dire quand nous vous ferons part d’une possibilité d’emploi. Nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

Consultez cette page pour en savoir plus sur notre processus de recrutement et votre parcours de candidat ou de candidate.

Si vous travaillez déjà pour Intact ou belairdirect, veuillez postuler à ce poste sur notre site carrière interne.
Show more

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
Description:
About Oxygen8

At Oxygen8, we help create healthy spaces for people to live, work, and play in an energy-efficient way. Since 2019, Oxygen8 has developed and manufactured high-efficiency commercial and multi-family residential ventilation systems that help improve the health and wellness of buildings and their occupants. Oxygen8’s 100% electric dedicated outside air systems with high-efficiency energy recovery address current human health and changing climate challenges while significantly improving health and environmental impact. Through innovation, collaboration, and intelligent design, our solutions integrate seamlessly into building systems and are paired with smart monitoring and control systems. At Oxygen8, we make #freshairthatfits.

About The Role

At Oxygen8, we are seeking a Manufacturing Engineer to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our manufacturing operations. This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of a mature manufacturing facility and create novel processes, aligning with our goal to become a world-class manufacturer of premium Air Handling and Ventilation equipment.

This role provides endless possibilities for growth and development within a fast-paced and expanding company. As a key member of the manufacturing engineering team, you will have the opportunity to influence the direction of our operations and contribute to the creation of healthy indoor environments through innovative ventilation solutions.

If you are passionate about engineering, process optimization, and contributing to a sustainable future, we invite you to apply and join us in revolutionizing the way we ventilate, heat, cool, dehumidify, and humidify our buildings.

Key Responsibilities

Work closely with the Manufacturing Engineering team, Production and Engineering to support:


Prototype builds and process development.
Improve current production process capability and repeatability through the optimization of existing manufacturing processes.
Conduct time studies, identify capacity constraints and opportunities to improve efficiencies and reduce manufacturing costs.
Implementing 5S rules.
Development and maintaining manufacturing documentation.
Updates and collaborates on overall plant layout.
Investigates any new concepts or ideas that could improve any aspect specific to manufacturing/production.
Work with Supply Chain to manage product inventory and ensure proper inventory levels.


Focus Areas


Process Improvement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement enhancements in current manufacturing processes, ensuring increased efficiency, productivity, and capacity.
New Product Introduction: Engage in the development and integration of new products into the manufacturing process, ensuring seamless transitions and adherence to quality standards.
Facility Development: Contribute to the planning and establishment of new facilities to meet the growing demands of the North American market, ensuring scalability and operational excellence.
Innovation: Develop and implement novel processes and techniques to produce high-quality products, addressing the aggressive growth targets set by the company.


Experience And Skills


Engineering or Technical Degree in progress
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail and highly organized
Experience with Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DFMA)
Minimum 1yr experience as a ME working directly on process development or equivalent role
Comfortable working in a manufacturing environment in a hands-on position
Team player with positive attitude, excellent collaborative and interpersonal skills
Excellent ability to multitask and work efficiently within deadlines
Willingness to learn and be part of a dynamic team environment


Working with Oxygen8

Benefits

At Oxygen8, we strongly believe in building a team that works well together, and we are committed to creating an environment that is inclusive and provides the space for individuals to learn and grow. We are proud to offer the following benefits to our team members:


Company Team Building Events
Employee Stock Option Plan
Health and Dental Benefit Coverage from day 1
3 Weeks Paid Vacation
Paid Volunteer Day
Personal Development and Training Opportunities


Annual Salary


$65,000 to $75,000 based on experience.


Location and Schedule:


On site 40 hours per week at our South Burnaby office and occasionally at our East Vancouver office
Monday to Friday 8am to 4:30pm (TBD)

Title: Research Associate
Description:
Academic

Job Category

Faculty Non Bargaining

Job Title

Research Associate

Department

Research | Putnins Lab | Department of Oral Biological and Medical Sciences | Faculty of Dentistry (Edward Putnins)

Posting End Date

September 15, 2025

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the Posting End Date.

Job End Date

May 31, 2026

A full-time grant-funded Research Associate position in the area of drug-mediated regulation of chronic inflammation is available beginning October 1, 2025 for 8 months with the possibility of an extension. This position requires expertise in cell biology, molecular biology, and animal work. The expected salary for this position is $68,932 per year.

Required scientific background:


A PhD degree in life sciences (e.g. biochemistry, cell biology, immunology, pharmacology).
Additional years of postdoctoral experience in a related area.
Proficiency with the following techniques is essential:
Mammalian cell culture
Methods to identify drug–protein target and off-target interactions
Protein expression and localization
Western blotting (immunoprecipitation, pull-down assays)
Immunohisto- and cytochemistry using multi-fluorochromes and confocal microscopy
Multiplex cytokine analysis (Mesoscale)
Gene expression
Quantitative RT-PCR
RNA interference
Experience in all aspects of mouse protocol development and handling.

Additional requirements:


Experience as a lab manager.
Strong interpersonal skills with experience in setting and achieving goals.
Ability to educate and train undergraduate and graduate students.
Ability to arrange, interpret, and graph data using computer software (Prism GraphPad, SPSS).
Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as part of the PI and collaborator teams.
Strong verbal and written English communication and organizational skills.


Equity and diversity are essential to academic excellence. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

UBC hires on the basis of merit and is committed to employment equity. We encourage all qualified persons to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents of Canada will be given priority. Please indicate your legal status to work in Canada.

Forward a letter of application (including the names and addresses of three referees) and CV by September 15, 2025 to:

Angela Tether, UBC Faculty of Dentistry

E-mail: angela@dentistry.ubc.ca

Note: due to the large number of applications received, we regret that we are unable to confirm receipt of submissions or provide the status of competitions; only those applicants being interviewed will be contacted.

E-mail: angela@dentistry.ubc.ca

Note: due to the large number of applications received, we regret that we are unable to confirm receipt of submissions or provide the status of competitions; only those applicants being interviewed will be contacted.

Title: AI Automation & Agent Deployment Engineer
Description:
Company: SETR (Canada-based, Global Team)

Location: Remote (Canada preferred)

Salary: $80,000-$120,000 CAD/year + Performance Bonuses + Fast Growth Upside

Type: Full-Time (Contract-to-Hire Option Available)

🌍 About SETR

SETR is building the future of outbound sales — powered by AI.

We've replaced bloated SDR teams with intelligent, voice-powered AI agents that can cold call, follow up, and book meetings — all autonomously.

We're backed by serious operators, already cash-flowing, and scaling fast. We don't do red tape, bloated teams, or endless meetings.

We do fast execution, real results, and building something that will reshape the industry.

🎯 Who This Is NOT For:


People who need hand-holding or want to "consult" but not build
Builders who are afraid of AI, ambiguity, or rapid growth
Anyone who isn't obsessed with process, logic, and optimizing every workflow to the pixel


🚨 Ready to Build the Future?

If you're one of the best in the world at automation and AI agents — and want a seat at the table of something big — we want you yesterday.

Apply now, or DM us with your portfolio of automations, workflows, or bots you've built. Bonus points if you can break down how your systems generated actual revenue or saved hours.

🧠 TL;DR - Why This Role is a No-Brainer

We're SETR — one of the fastest-growing AI automation companies out there. We build autonomous AI sales teams that actually convert, powered by voice bots, multi-channel outreach, and intelligent workflows that replace humans.

We don't need more dashboards or consultants. We need a technical operator who lives and breathes automation and AI agent deployment, and can scale systems like a mad scientist.

You'll own the back-end automation architecture and help us redefine how companies grow.

🔥 What You'll Own (and Crush):


Build, deploy, and scale AI agents using tools like Relevance AI, LangChain, or your own prompt chains
Own the full automation stack — using n8n, Zapier, Make.com, Python scripts, and API integrations to eliminate grunt work across ops, sales, and onboarding
Design multi-platform lead engagement flows (SMS, email, AI voice, chatbot, calendar scheduling, CRM triggers) that feel like magic
Build smart logic into CRM tools like GoHighLevel, HubSpot, or Salesforce
Architect fail-proof triggers across multiple systems (GHL, Ringable, Slack, Twilio, Airtable, webhooks)
Ship clean, scalable, documented flows that convert like crazy and don't break under pressure
Continuously optimize, test, and improve workflows for speed, cost-efficiency, and performance


Requirements


3-5+ years hands-on building automations (n8n, Zapier, Make.com, Integromat, etc.)
Experience deploying AI agents — via Relevance AI, GPTs, LangChain, or similar tools
You've built real-world automations that save teams hours per day or generate revenue on autopilot
You understand APIs, webhooks, conditional logic, and error handling deeply
You're obsessed with clean logic, smart triggers, scalability, and making sure flows don't break
You're a builder. You think in flows. You document your work like a pro
Bonus: Comfortable writing custom Python/JavaScript scripts to extend logic
Bonus: Experience with CRM tools like GoHighLevel, Salesforce, or HubSpot


Benefits


$80,000-$120,000 CAD/year depending on experience
Performance bonuses for hitting automation efficiency or revenue KPIs
Opportunity for equity or rev share as the company scales
Freedom to build your own automation playground — we trust you
Zero micromanagement, fully async-friendly, global team
Fast-track to a leadership position as we scale

Title: Research Assistant
Description:
Staff - Non Union

Job Category

Non Union Technicians and Research Assistants

Job Profile

Non Union Salaried - Research Assistant /Technician 3

Job Title

Research Assistant

Department

Henderson Laboratory | Centre for Disease Control | Faculty of Medicine

Compensation Range

$4,567.04 - $5,385.67 CAD Monthly

Posting End Date

August 19, 2025

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the Posting End Date.

Job End Date

August 31, 2026

This position is expected to be filled by promotion/reassignment and is included here to inform you of its vacancy at the University.

At UBC, we believe that attracting and sustaining a diverse workforce is key to the successful pursuit of excellence in research, innovation, and learning for all faculty, staff and students. Our commitment to employment equity helps achieve inclusion and fairness, brings rich diversity to UBC as a workplace, and creates the necessary conditions for a rewarding career.

Job Summary

The Research Assistant will provide support to multiple research projects related to the health effects of wildfire smoke. The incumbent will be involved in a wide range of research activities spanning the research cycle, including ethics applications, data access requests, literature searches, data cleaning and preparation, epidemiologic analyses, and preparing knowledge translation materials, including presentations, reports, and scientific journal articles.

Organizational Status

Reports to Scientific Director, Environmental Health Services at the BC Centre for Disease Control, who is also a Professor (Partner) at the UBC School of Population and Public Health. Works closely with other investigators, research staff, and graduate trainees working on the same group of projects at SFU, UBC, BCCDC, and other partner agencies

Work Performed


Prepares exposure and health outcomes data for epidemiologic analyses.
Conducts epidemiologic analyses.
Assists with administrative research functions, including ethics applications and data access requests.
Conducts literature review.
Assists in the writing and preparation of scientific manuscripts.
Assists in the preparation of scientific and knowledge translation presentations.
Attends regular project meetings.
Engages with other project partners.
Identifies issues with project and suggests solutions.
Develops timelines to ensure tasks are completed on time, reports on progress, and troubleshoots to ensure deadlines are met.
May be asked to participate in other ongoing studies.
Any other duties as required.


Consequence of Error/Judgement

Due to the use of administrative health data, this individual must understand and exemplify the ethics of confidentiality, sensitivity, and respect when communicating all study information. The Research Assistant must be exceptionally detail-orientated and organized and able to follow detailed instructions. They must be able to prioritize tasks to ensure that time-sensitive duties are completed in priority. This person must also be self-directed, able to excel in a team environment, know personal limitations and take initiative to ask for assistance when needed.

Supervision Received

Work under general supervision of the Scientific Director or delegate, receiving detailed instructions on the assignment of new duties and oversight thereafter. The incumbent should be able to identify circumstances that require consultation with the supervisor or other team members and be able to seek out that consultation when needed to advance project objectives.

Supervision Given

This position may oversee and direct some work done by graduate research trainees or other, more less experienced staff working on the project

Minimum Qualifications

Completion of a relevant technical program or a university degree in a relevant discipline and a minimum three years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Willingness to respect diverse perspectives, including perspectives in conflict with one’s own
Demonstrates a commitment to enhancing one’s own awareness, knowledge, and skills related to equity, diversity, and inclusion


Preferred Qualifications


Advanced knowledge of R, Python, or other coding language for public health analytics.
Some knowledge of quantitative research methods applicable to health research.
Some knowledge about climate change and environmental exposures, such as wildfire smoke and extreme heat.
Effective use of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook at an intermediate level.
Strong attention to detail, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Ability to effectively prioritize tasks, adapt to changing priorities, multi-task and meet deadlines.
Ability to learn new software, research methods, and work routines.
Ability to exercise appropriate tact, discretion and confidentiality in all matters.
Ability to exercise sound judgement, responsibility, and maintain confidentiality.
Ability to communicate well both verbally and in writing.
Ability to work effectively independently and within a collaborative team environment.
Show more
